nodes.title: Build StumbleUpon clone with Bluesky firehose
nodes.metadata_json:
{"confidence":95,"prompt":"User's original request:
"I want to build a StumbleUpon like experience using the Bluesky Firehose as the source of the links

requirements:
1. Bookmarklet
2. Website
3. AT protocol lexicon
4. OAuth with atproto
5. Landing page"

Follow-up clarifications:
- Quality signals: "follower count, reply count"
- Lexicon: "link, metadata, user prefs, tags"
- Strategy: "we are gonna get a lot of links at the start and slowly refine our quality filter"
- Discovery: "you start on discovery and then we can do tags for similar content"
- Project name: "we are calling it poke_around"
- HTTP library: "Use Req for HTTP requests"
- Firehose: "use the graze stuff" (Turbostream)
- Architecture: "dont think we need broadway...use normal elixir stuff"

Completed:
âœ“ Bookmarklet
âœ“ Website (stumble UI)
âœ“ Firehose integration

Remaining:
- AT Protocol lexicon
- OAuth with atproto
- Landing page (currently stumble IS the landing)"}

nodes.title: Choose quality signals for link filtering
nodes.metadata_json:
{"confidence":90,"prompt":"User specified quality signals for filtering links from the firehose:
"1. follower count, reply count"

Decision: Use author follower count as primary quality signal.
- Minimum 100 followers required to pass filter
- Exclude replies (is_reply: true)
- Score calculated as: log10(followers) * 20, capped at 100

This filters out spam accounts and low-quality posts while keeping signal from established users."}

nodes.title: Choose firehose source
nodes.metadata_json:
{"confidence":95,"prompt":"User suggested using Graze Turbostream instead of raw Jetstream:
"should we use https://www.graze.social/docs/graze-turbostream"
"yeah lets use the graze stuff"

Decision: Use Graze Turbostream WebSocket API
- URL: wss://api.graze.social/app/api/v1/turbostream/turbostream
- Provides hydrated events with author profiles inline
- No need for separate API calls to resolve DIDs to profiles
- Includes follower_count, display_name, avatar directly in events
- Uses snake_case keys (followers_count not followersCount)

Key insight: Turbostream event structure is different from raw Jetstream:
- Keys: at_uri, did, hydrated_metadata, message, time_us
- Author data in hydrated_metadata.user (not .author)"}

nodes.title: Choose concurrency architecture
nodes.metadata_json:
{"confidence":90,"prompt":"User explicitly rejected Broadway for processing:
"also I dont think we need broadway here...we can just use normal elixir stuff to start"

Decision: Use simple GenServer/Supervisor pattern
- WebSockex for WebSocket connection
- Phoenix PubSub for broadcasting events
- GenServer for link extraction (subscribes to PubSub)
- Standard Elixir supervision tree

Rationale: Broadway adds complexity for batching/acknowledgment that isn't needed here.
The firehose is continuous - we process each event immediately and store links.
Simple GenServer pattern is sufficient and easier to debug."}

nodes.title: Implement Turbostream WebSocket client
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/bluesky-firehose","commit":"6fd0fae","confidence":95,"files":["lib/poke_around/bluesky/firehose.ex","lib/poke_around/bluesky/parser.ex","lib/poke_around/bluesky/types.ex","lib/poke_around/bluesky/supervisor.ex"],"prompt":"Implementation of Bluesky firehose client using Graze Turbostream.

Files created:
- lib/poke_around/bluesky/firehose.ex - WebSockex client
- lib/poke_around/bluesky/parser.ex - Event parser with snake_case handling
- lib/poke_around/bluesky/types.ex - Structs for Post, Author, ExternalEmbed, FacetLink
- lib/poke_around/bluesky/supervisor.ex - Supervisor for firehose process

Key implementation details:
1. WebSockex connects to wss://api.graze.social/app/api/v1/turbostream/turbostream
2. Filters for app.bsky.feed.post create operations
3. Parses hydrated_metadata.user for author info (snake_case keys)
4. Extracts links from both embeds and facets
5. Broadcasts posts via Phoenix.PubSub to "bluesky:posts"
6. Pattern matching for valid_link? (filters bsky.app, bsky.social, at:// URLs)

Debug process: Had to log event keys to discover Turbostream format differed from Jetstream docs."}

nodes.title: Firehose connected and receiving ~100 msgs/sec
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/bluesky-firehose","confidence":95,"prompt":"Firehose integration successful after debugging event format issues.

Results:
- Connected to Turbostream and receiving ~100 messages/second
- Posts with external embeds and facet links being extracted
- Author metadata (followers_count, handle, display_name) correctly parsed
- Links being stored in database (353+ links observed during initial testing)

Issues resolved:
1. Initial code expected Jetstream format with "kind"/"commit" keys
   - Fixed: Updated to match Turbostream keys (at_uri, message, hydrated_metadata)
2. Expected "author" in metadata but actual key is "user"
   - Fixed: parse_turbostream_author matches on "user"
3. Expected camelCase but Turbostream uses snake_case
   - Fixed: followers_count not followersCount"}

nodes.title: Design and implement links database schema
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/links-database","commit":"a7e5a73","confidence":95,"files":["lib/poke_around/links/link.ex","priv/repo/migrations/20260109193658_create_links.exs"],"prompt":"Database schema for storing discovered links.

Files created:
- lib/poke_around/links/link.ex - Ecto schema
- priv/repo/migrations/20260109193658_create_links.exs - Migration

Schema fields:
- url (string, required) - The actual link URL
- url_hash (string, unique index) - SHA256 hash for deduplication
- domain (string, indexed) - Extracted domain for stats
- title (string) - Page title from embed or post
- description (text) - Description from embed
- score (integer, indexed) - Quality score 0-100
- stumble_count (integer, default 0) - Times shown to users

Author metadata (denormalized for display):
- author_did, author_handle, author_display_name
- author_avatar, author_followers_count

Post context:
- post_uri, post_text - Original Bluesky post reference

Indexes: url_hash (unique), domain, score, inserted_at"}

nodes.title: Implement link extractor with quality filtering
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/link-processing","commit":"44c48ba","confidence":95,"files":["lib/poke_around/links/extractor.ex","lib/poke_around/links.ex"],"prompt":"Link extraction and quality filtering implementation.

Files created:
- lib/poke_around/links/extractor.ex - GenServer that processes firehose posts
- lib/poke_around/links.ex - Context module for link operations

Extractor logic:
1. Subscribes to "bluesky:posts" PubSub topic
2. For each post, checks qualifies?/1:
   - Author must have >= 100 followers
   - Must not be a reply (is_reply: false)
3. Extracts links from parser results
4. Filters out invalid links (bsky.app, bsky.social, at://)
5. Calculates score: log10(followers) * 20, capped at 100
6. Stores via Links.store_link/1 (upserts on url_hash)

Links context provides:
- store_link/1 - Insert or update link
- random_link/1 - Get random link with min_score and exclude_ids options
- increment_stumble_count/1 - Track link impressions
- count_links/0, top_domains/1 - Stats for UI

Quality filtering rationale: 100 followers filters out most spam bots while keeping
real users who share interesting content."}

nodes.title: User requested simple GenServer pattern, not Broadway
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/link-processing","confidence":100,"prompt":"User explicitly rejected Broadway in favor of simpler architecture:
"also I dont think we need broadway here...we can just use normal elixir stuff to start"

This informed the entire processing architecture:
- Simple GenServer for Extractor instead of Broadway pipeline
- Direct PubSub subscription instead of Broadway producers/consumers
- No batching or acknowledgment complexity
- Easier to reason about and debug

The simpler approach proved sufficient - firehose runs at ~100 msgs/sec which 
a single GenServer handles easily without backpressure concerns."}

nodes.title: Build stumble LiveView interface
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"feature/stumble-ui","commit":"34ca01f","confidence":95,"files":["lib/poke_around_web/live/stumble_live.ex","lib/poke_around_web/router.ex"],"prompt":"Main stumble interface using Phoenix LiveView.

Files created:

- Updated router.ex: live "/", StumbleLive, :index

UI Features:
1. Header with app name and total link count
2. Link card showing:
   - Author avatar (first letter), handle, display name
   - Follower count badge
   - Post text excerpt (truncated to 200 chars)
   - Clickable link button with domain and URL
   - Score badge
3. "Stumble!" button to get next random link
4. Session history tracking (up to 50 links)
5. Footer with top domains stats

Implementation details:
- mount/3: Loads random link with min_score: 20
- handle_event("stumble"): Gets new link excluding history, increments stumble_count
- handle_event("refresh-stats"): Updates stats display
- Helper functions: truncate/2, format_followers/1

Design: Gradient purple/pink background, glassmorphism cards, Tailwind CSS"}

nodes.title: Implement bookmarklet and API endpoint
User feedback: use pattern matching for valid_link? not cond
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"User feedback on code style in parser.ex:
"use pattern matching here"

Original code used cond:
  cond do
    String.contains?(uri, "bsky.app") -> false
    String.starts_with?(uri, "https://") -> true
    ...
  end

Corrected to pattern matching:
  defp valid_link?("https://bsky.app" <> _), do: false
  defp valid_link?("http://bsky.app" <> _), do: false
  defp valid_link?("https://bsky.social" <> _), do: false
  defp valid_link?("http://bsky.social" <> _), do: false
  defp valid_link?("at://" <> _), do: false
  defp valid_link?("https://" <> _), do: true
  defp valid_link?("http://" <> _), do: true
  defp valid_link?(_), do: false

Benefits: More idiomatic Elixir, clearer intent, leverages BEAM pattern matching."}

nodes.title: Refine link quality signals v2
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":80,"prompt":"User requested refined quality filtering criteria:

"1. user posting has > 500 followers
2. replies are OK but they have to meet the above requirement
3. the post with the link should not have more than one hashtag
4. if the post has a LOT of replies, this is a boost
5. weigh people with more followers higher, but only if they follow less than 5000 people themselves"

Additional criteria added:
- "no accounts less than a year old"
- "bio has to be filled"
- "no bare links"
- "no multiple links"

Final criteria implemented:
- Author: >= 500 followers (up from 100)
- Author: <= 5000 following (ratio filter)
- Author: account >= 1 year old (indexed_at check)
- Author: non-empty bio/description required
- Post: >= 50 chars text (no bare links)
- Post: max 1 hashtag
- Post: exactly 1 link (multiple = spam)
- Replies: now allowed if all criteria met

Note: Reply count boost not implemented (requires API calls we don't have)"}

nodes.title: Implement refined quality signals v2
Found hashtag-only posts passing filter - text length was including hashtag chars
Purge old links not meeting new quality criteria
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":100,"prompt":"Ran cleanup to purge links that passed old filters but fail new criteria.

SQL queries:
1. DELETE WHERE author_followers_count < 500 OR IS NULL
2. DELETE WHERE length(regexp_replace(post_text, '#[a-zA-Z0-9_]+', '', 'g')) < 50

Results:
- Before: 389 links
- Deleted for low followers: 131
- Deleted for short text: 35
- After: 223 links
- Total removed: 166 (43%)"}

Fonts: Geneva, VT323 (Google Fonts fallback), Monaco for monospace"}

nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":85,"prompt":"lets look at the lexicon atproto piece of this

we need to figure out a way to package things up so that we are using a lexicon and ATProto PDS to save the links, tags, etc and tie it into the higher order bluesky/atproto network

lets do option 1 then option 2 with it

I dont have the domain pokearound.space but no hosting for it at the moment

the primary goal is a few things

1) get users to find new content in interesting ways and mark their own
2) primarily provide this via a bookmarklet
3) have the site too for "fuckin casuals" who are just clicking not contributing and its a format they are used to
4) RSS with filtering based on topic or something
5) make this a project that successfully finds the best links on bluesky"}

nodes.title: Improve link quality algorithm - engagement metrics, maturation, ad filtering
nodes.metadata_json:
{"branch":"main","confidence":80,"prompt":"So now that we have this going, lets think about the algorithm to find good links

we probably wanna find stuff with more replies maybe?

I think another thing is with the firehose its like you wanna wait a bit to see how the post pans out you dont immediately deem it worthy, maybe we have another layer that filters even further by enriching and seeing reply count, number of likes, number of reposts, etc and use things like that to get specifically good links

We also could like figure out a way to avoid stuff that is clearly ads but what will that look like as just a tendency? Tough to get totally right

what do you think?"}
